content: Yes, that's right. When removing a pile of chicken manure, it is likely that the manure would be broken down and removed portion by portion rather than all at once. This would result in a more complex mechanical process than if the manure could be treated as a single rigid body. Additionally, the structure of the manure and the way it has been piled up may affect how it breaks down and how it adheres to the plastic surface, which could further complicate the removal process.
